Key Match Events: The Guardians rallied to save their season with a game-tying, two-out, two-run home run in the ninth inning and a two-out, two-run, walk-off home run in the 10th inning.
Andrés Giménez made a crucial defensive play in the top of the 10th, ranging far to his left to stab a ground ball and throwing a bouncer to first baseman Josh Naylor to retire Jazz Chisholm Jr.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Stephen Vogt emphasized the importance of the team's resilience and never quitting, saying 'That's exactly who we are.'
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt praised Andrés Giménez, saying 'Andrés Giménez is the best infielder on the planet.'
Jhonkensy Noel downplayed the excitement of the win, saying 'The goal is to get to the World Series. When we get to that point, that’s when we’re going to be a little more celebratory mode.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees continued to run into inexplicable outs on the bases, which the Guardians capitalized on.
The Guardians showed some real force with the home runs by Jhonkensy Noel and David Fry, which showed some real force.
